channel.title: BBC News - Africa
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Nigerian student shocked to see friend's body in anatomy class
item.description: Nigerian students often dissect "unclaimed" bodies from mortuaries but some are victims of police violence.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Morocco's Soufiane El Bakkali wins steeplechase gold as Hellen Obiri wins 5,000m silver
item.description: Morocco's Soufiane El Bakkali wins the men's 3,000m steeplechase as Kenya's Hellen Obiri wins silver in the women's 5,000m on day 10 of the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: Rebels vow to fight on until blockade ends
item.description: Gen Tsadkan, who leads the rebel forces, tells the BBC they aim to reclaim lost territory.

item.title: Nigeria suspends 'Hushpuppi-linked' police officer Abba Kyari
item.description: The deputy commissioner is indicted in the US for allegedly taking a bribe from an influencer.

item.title: Madagascar arrests generals over plot to kill President Rajoelina
item.description: The thwarted attempt to kill President Andry Rajoelina is the latest turmoil to strike the island nation.

item.title: 'You can be African and black and play polo'
item.description: Molawa Adesuyi is calling for more young people from ethnic minority backgrounds to take up his sport.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Akani Simbine finishes fourth in the 100m as Ghana secure boxing medal on day nine
item.description: Akani Simbine finishes fourth in the men's 100m final as boxer Samuel Takyi secures a medal for Ghana on day nine of the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Namibian athlete says 'You can't tell me now I am not a woman'
item.description: Namibia's Beatrice Masilingi is excited to compete at the Olympics despite being forced out of the 400m due to high levels of testosterone.

item.title: Nigeria's kidnap crisis: 'I saw my two-year-old carried by a man with a gun'
item.description: Parents of schoolchildren abducted in Nigeria describe their trauma, and dilemma over the ransom demands.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 23-29 July 2021
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent and beyond.

item.title: South Africa riots: The inside story of Durban's week of anarchy
item.description: The worst unrest since white-minority rule ended has left deep scars, especially in the coastal city of Durban.

item.title: Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue and his love of Bugattis and Michael Jackson
item.description: Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue, tipped as Equatorial Guinea's next leader, is under sanctions in the UK and France.

item.title: Zimbabwean with football dreams to be kicked out of UK
item.description: Christopher Arundell grew up in the UK but after doing time in jail is being deported to Zimbabwe.

item.title: Covid in Tanzania: Vaccination campaign gets underway
item.description: President Samia Suluhu's decision to have a Covid vaccine marks a change of approach for Tanzania.

item.title: Sunday Igboho: What's stopping Benin extraditing the Nigerian separatist leader?
item.description: Nigeria's plan to have Sunday Igboho extradited are fading as he faces criminal accusations in Benin.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Taking care of mental health in elite sports
item.description: Dr. Tshepang Tshube says it is vital for elite athletes like Simone Biles to protect their mental health.

item.title: Kenya's first female paraglider on life from a bird's eye view
item.description: "Kenya 1" aka Nyambura Kariuki, shares her thoughts on being Kenya's first ever female paraglider.

item.title: Sunflower farming blooms in Kenya after khat export ban
item.description: Some farmers are growing sunflowers to boost their incomes after a ban on exports of the khat plant.

item.title: The women fighting infertility stigma in Nigeria
item.description: Three Nigerian women confront the prejudice they have faced on their fertility journeys.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics 2020: 'I'm Nigerian and Ghanaian, but I compete for Ghana'
item.description: Triple jumper Nadia Eke talks dance, jollof and wellbeing as she prepares to compete at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Niger President Mohamed Bazoum on the importance of keeping girls in school
item.description: Niger President Mohamed Bazoum says that his country must work hard to keep girls in school.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Kenya's runners form 'mum's club'
item.description: Top Kenyan female athletes have been juggling parenting and training for the Tokyo Olympics.
